If you love to stay on top of cutting-edge technologies and want to create a revolutionary product with us. Flexible working hours. Work the hours that make you more happy and productive, keeping in mind time-zones and work deliverables. Simultaneously learn and contribute, while working with big studios and indie developers. You will get the opportunity to work with the best, take on a lot of responsibility and grow.

Stock Options program. Joining the Conclify core team, means you are entrusted to own part of the company.

In charge of all visual aspects, branding and the look and feel of both Conclify and our games.
In charge of the production or selection of mockups and any visual or game assets.
You will hold the leading role in the game production process.
You will be brain storming and developing ideas, for new features and content.
You will contribute to the creation of new concepts and pitches.
Make tough decisions while being aware of the impact on the business.
Develop and manage Conclify's game developers' network.

Have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset.
Very high levels of enthusiasm, energy and passion for games, games development and a good understanding of what makes a game visually appealing and fun to play.
Be proactive, self-motivated and able to inspire and motivate a team of creative talents.
Can-do attitude with speed and product in mind.
Ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks.
Strong interpersonal and written communications ability and skills.
Business mindset. Decision making. Problem solving.
Have a team-oriented attitude and analytical mind.
Have a distinctive and original style.
Demonstrate a desire to learn and grow professionally.
Be able to take criticism and feedback on your ideas, take a step back and then iterate, but at the same time have confidence in your ideas, i.e. a balance of humbleness to accept feedback of others with confidence in your thinking.
Experience working in agile and rapid prototyping.
Extensive knowledge of (mobile) games.

Would be nice: Creative in new game concepts.

We're hiring a UI designer to play a major role in driving forward our design initiative, creating a memorable experience for our users with beautiful, intuitive and well thought out interfaces. 

Core responsibility

~ design beautiful and intuitive interfaces for our product ~

Core tasks

  • Responsible for designing all UI elements and assets for the product development pipeline across mobile, tablet and desktop.
  • Own the visual identity of the YouCanBook.me brand across our marketing sites and web applications
  • Create, improve and standardise our design systems, principles and assets.
  • Work with the Head of UX to research and understand customer usage to help define requirements for new product features and releases.

Skills / Experience we would expect to see:

  • Mid to senior UI designer, with probably 3 years or more designing web applications
  • Hands-on experience creating storyboards, user flows, wireframes, prototypes and pixel perfect mockups and designs
  • A user centred design process with a focus on understanding users to inform design decisions.
  • Knowledge and opinions about systems and how best to do things - we’re looking for a balance of ‘been there before’ and ‘oooh, would like to get stuck in and learn how to do that’
  • A passion for design theory such as grid systems, colour, typography and iconography
  • A strong portfolio, focussed on web application design, to demonstrate your work and design thinking.

Stop wondering what it would be like to work for an amazing company.
Apply to come and work for one.*

We are YouCanBook.me - one of the fastest growing scheduling tools in the world...

. . . our tool is big (hundreds of thousands of users and customers)
. . . the number of bookings we’ve done is big (30 million to date)
. . . the love is big (top scheduling app on G2 Crowd)

but as a company, we are super tiny.

We’re 100% remote, 100% bootstrapped, profitable and growing.

We’ve decided it’s time to expand the team.

Don't apply if you're looking to rise up the ranks of a mega-corp. Instead, join our ranks, and build your craft inside our tardis.

We need you.

What we’re about:

You would get to work for a company with some amazing customers - everyone from the single marketeer or university professor, to the some of the biggest companies in the world (customers from Pearson, Box, Yelp, Shopify, Pinterest, Expedia, Atlassian and many, many more all use our tool).

Our company has been named one of the top performing UK tech companies by G2 Crowd. We love sponsoring conferences like SaaStock in London and SDX in Portland in June

Our co-founder and CEO, Bridget Harris, has been named a national finalist in the digital category for the 'Forward Ladies' awards for women in business. She's a regular speaker at conferences like Business of Software and Microconf and this year was speaking at LTV Conf and SaaStock 2018.

Why does that matter? Because we like sharing how we 'walk the talk' on company culture and building a sustainable, happy software business.

We are working to build an amazing place where work gets done. You'd be joining a handful of smart, imaginative, hard workers and learners. We meet up around twice a year from our locations in the US, Spain and the UK. This year we met up in the wonderful Costa Rica. We share and build. We celebrate success together. We work on where we went wrong, and build something better.

We like: systems, processes, automation, documentation, scaling, profit and happy customers.

We don't like: over-working, being stressed, sloppy work, typs, actual offices, paperwork, not being able to help.

You need to join us.

*All our jobs are secure and employed - this position is UK (remote) only

  • private health + dental insurance 
  • 25-30 days PTO (it’s flexible) + public holidays
  • Generous paternity + maternity benefits
  • International travel (our last two company retreats were Portugal and Costa Rica)

Product Designer

DockYard

DockYard seeks an exceptional Product Designer with a passion for UX and visual design to join our remote team in creating user-centered web applications!

Product Designer

This is an amazing opportunity to become a member of our exceptional product design team for a premiere, full-stack software consultancy. DockYard works with ambitious clients across a range of verticals, including: Netflix, Flywheel Sports, McGraw-Hill Education, Zipcar, and more.

We have a holistic approach to product design with an amazing team of designers and engineers. We are looking for someone who enjoys the challenge of making the complex simple and has a passion for the intersection of technology and design.

You are a full-stack product designer. Your workflow includes product discovery, design strategy, wireframing, user journey mapping, iterative prototyping, user research, user testing, and visual design.   • Bring solid research and discovery practices to inform design and UX solutions
  • Wireframe, prototype, and create hi-fidelity designs
  • Craft beautiful and elegant user-centered solutions
  • Partner with our engineers, UXD, PMs and stakeholders to oversee user experience for products and features from conception to launch
  • Work in solidarity with our customers and other DockYard teams
  • Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with engineers and designers
  • Provide and seek feedback from other designers to always push quality

  • An excellent communicator who can work well with clients and diverse teams
  • Experience designing and shipping products that customers love
  • Experience with the full-range of product, interaction, and visual design
  • Experience using data to inform design and product decisions
  • Talent in creating and maintaining complex design systems
  • Ability to clearly communicate product strategy, design rationale and conceptual ideas

About OLIO

At OLIO we're solving a really big problem (food waste) and are doing it in a sophisticated but elegant way (mobile technology combined with the sharing economy). In just over two years, over half a million users have joined us and have together shared 3/4 million portions of food. We're looking for people to join our team who are passionate about the cause, and who want to work in a challenging, but exciting and collaborative environment as we embark upon the next phase of our growth.

JOIN OUR TEAM!

In order to accelerate OLIO to its next level in growth and impact, we are recruiting for a Product Designer. You will report into Viv Taylor, Product Manager, with a dotted reporting line into Lloyd Watkin, Lead Developer.

In this role you will be responsible for:

- All aspects of the creative design, UI and UX for the OLIO apps (Android, iOS & web app), and other digital assets (web site, emails, social media content)
- Developing, maintaining & enforcing clear creative guidelines that embody the OLIO brand
- Undertaking user research and reviewing engagement data to ensure a user-centric design process
- Designing storyboards, wireframes and mock-ups of simple, engaging experiences for our users
- Liaising with the development & product stakeholders to get feedback on, and buy-in for, your proposed designs
- Delivering detailed, pixel perfect assets and specs to our developers
- Continuously think about how to improve the user experience across our products
- Proposing ways in which the OLIO product experience can ‘surprise & delight’ our users through creative design
- Keeping up to date with the latest guidelines and trends for mobile design

Once you have proven yourself you will have great freedom and autonomy, coupled with an enormous opportunity for personal development. All of our roles are remote working roles, however for London based team members there is the ability to co-work as well. We live for our mission, but like to have fun along the way!

IS THIS YOU?

Our ideal candidate will first and foremost be as passionate about our mission as we are! In addition to this, you will have the following experience and skills:

- Experience in designing mobile user interfaces for hybrid/native mobile apps is essential
- Detailed knowledge of material design and Apple Human Interface Guidelines
- Expert knowledge in user experience principles, graphic design and mobile & responsive web standards
- Strong visual design skills evidenced by examples of where you’ve created pixel-perfect consumer products
- Recognise the value of getting an MVP into the market and learning and iterating from there
- Passion for user research and metrics that track product successes
- Expert level in Sketch/Photoshop and Illustrator
- Experience in creating interactive prototypes (ideally Marvel or Invision)
- Experience creating navigation and page layout/templates, functional design, iconography, look and feel and style guides
- An eye for detail

And all OLIO team members share these attributes:

- A self-starter with a ‘can-do’ attitude
- Resourceful and creative
- Thorough, but able to move quickly and decisively
- A ruthless ability to prioritise
- Excellent communication skills
- Fun to work with

ABOUT US
Sofar Sounds is bringing the magic back to live music, hosting intimate secret living room gigs over 400 cities world-wide. We are dedicated to supporting artists, transforming the way live music is experienced and discovered, offline and on.

Our inclusive, global community is the heart of Sofar. Reflecting this, our staff are based in NYC and London, with remote team members in South America, Europe and India.

Watch our intro video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qnjsN2NOl3k

ROLE & TEAM
We’re looking for an experienced UX designer to join us who is confident taking product development ideas through a lean, user-centred design process, from idea validation and research, to delivering web and app user journeys and interfaces, working with and improving our brand guidelines and component style-guide.

You’ll be joining our growing digital team, working closely with our tech and product teams, and junior UX researcher. You will be instrumental in product design decisions, across our online and digital experience. Our intimate concerts are truly magical. A key design goal is to reflect this magic and our love of artists online.

SKILLS & COMPETENCIES

Essential:
- Experience in working end-to-end with the product, defining problems and goals, creating user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, giving and soliciting feedback, and communicating to developers and stakeholders throughout the projects life cycles.
- Experience in UX research and user-testing, from surveys to in-person interviews. You should drive and justify your design decisions using the resulting of these learnings, along with data and design principles.
- An online portfolio that can demonstrate your visual design skills and your expertise in designing intuitive, delightful and efficient user interfaces, across web and mobile.

UX/UI Designer

Out of the Sandbox

Out of the Sandbox (https://outofthesandbox.com/) is the leading designer of premium Shopify themes and is known for providing an exceptional customer support experience. Our award-winning team has developed the most popular and best-reviewed themes available for Shopify. Shopify is a rapidly growing commerce platform with 500k+ merchants in over 150 countries.

Background and context for this role:

In the Shopify and theme design world, UX plays a particularly significant role because there are two different user types we must account for: the customer of the online shop as well as the “merchant” who will be interacting with the theme settings to setup their site.

The merchant’s experience of the setup process is affected by the availability and complexity of the settings they have at their disposal for each page, section and component of their theme, and we endeavor to keep this as clear and straightforward as possible, while still giving them lots of options and flexibility. 

At the same time, we want to ensure enough built-in consistency and best practices that they cannot inadvertently create a shop that leads to unsightly interfaces or poor UX for their customers.

As a UX/UI specialist, you will play a key role in researching, conceptualizing and designing interface solutions for these interesting yet unique UX/UI challenges! 

What you’ll do

  • Play a key role in establishing design standards and UI component libraries for new themes
  • Work with the Design Director to define and maintain the creative vision for both upcoming and existing themes, including overall styling and micro-interactions
  • Create conceptual wireframes for theme components and layouts, along with their related settings
  • Create high-fidelity mockups to solidify and illustrate the design direction for a theme, and to serve as a go-to reference for the development team
  • Create interactive prototypes for demonstration or user testing purposes
  • Advocate for UX best practices and design standards
  • Apply and maintain a consistent art style throughout the entire project interface
  • Collaborate with our dev, documentation, and support teams to help shape a successful user experience for both the merchant and end user of our themes
  • Review, test and approve design-related features, giving feedback and guidance to the dev team to help achieve pixel perfection
  • Suggest enhancements and improvements to our themes in terms of new features, improved UI, better UX on the theme editor side, etc.
  • Contribute to other design projects, including graphics and content creation for demo shops, social feeds and marketing campaigns

What you’ll need

  • Fluency in modern best practices for UX and interaction design, and a deep empathy for all users
  • Current with the latest UI trends, and keen on staying tuned to emerging UI technologies
  • Solid experience designing and prototyping mobile and desktop interfaces
  • Proficiency in Sketch, InVision, Balsamiq, Photoshop, or other prototyping tools
  • A strong portfolio demonstrating your passion for interactive design, including samples of wireframes, component libraries and live projects
  • Super detail-oriented, strong aesthetic sensibility and appreciation of good visual design
  • Excellent eye for color, shape, composition and iconography
  • Ability to articulate the rationale for design decisions
  • Basic understanding of HTML, CSS/SASS, JavaScript/jQuery and comfortable working with GitHub
  • Ability to work in a remotely distributed, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our awesome and highly technical team
  • Ability to embrace feedback and adapt designs as required in collaboration with other designers and the rest of the team
  • Comfortable working with flexible processes, knowing when to pivot and shift as necessary

Nice to have

  • Familiarity with a11y and usability requirements
  • Comfortable tweaking styles in CSS, editing Shopify’s liquid templates and interacting with git repositories
  • Previous experience with ecommerce sites
  • Familiarity with the Shopify platform in particular
  • Experience using a design methodology to improve workflow speed and efficiency
  • Motion graphic and animation design
  • Graphic design and image editing capabilities
  • Although Out of the Sandbox is a remote company, preference will be given to candidates based in Ottawa or Toronto

Senior Product Designer

Posted May 11

Help Scout
Headquarters: remote
www.helpscout.com/careers
View all Help Scout jobs →

Hello, there.

We’re Help Scout. A company you’ve maybe heard of before, or maybe not, but either way you’ve landed on this page because you were at least a little curious, and we like that about you. We spend our time making it easier for SMBs to talk with their customers. Today Help Scout is used by more than 8,000 businesses in 140 countries.

We’re looking for someone who’s really smart, and humble, and thorough, and meticulous, and self-motivated, and kind, and a little funny, and tenacious, and did I say self-motivated? Well, that’s because we’re a remote company! Being remote is fantastic, it’s empowering, and it’s perfect for people who like to be their own boss and push themselves to be at their very best every day.

That’s where you come in. As a Product Designer at Help Scout, you’ll spend your days creating tools that our customers use to deliver a great experience. Smiles on faces — if that’s your jam, we’d love to meet you.

About the role:

  • You’ll be the sixth member of the Help Scout design team. We work remotely from places like New York, Sydney, Ireland and Nashville. You can work from wherever you please as long as you have 4+ hours of overlap with EDT (US East Coast).
  • We’ll ask you to own the entire design process. For a new project, you’ll be given a brief and will partner with Product to do User/Customer research. You’ll be doing the wireframes, prototyping, visual design, interaction design, and will partner with engineers to get the implementation juuuuuust right.
  • You’ll be embedded on a couple cross-functional teams with one product lead, one QA, and 2-5 engineers depending on the project. You’ll work hand-in-hand with your teammates to ship your best work to our customers.
  • Although each designer is embedded on different teams, it’s important that everyone makes each other better. Over Slack, video chats, and design docs, you’ll provide guidance and critical feedback on other work outside of your purview. You’ll also get that sort of support from your teammates on your projects.
  • You will have the freedom to pioneer your own discovery phase and find ways to improve our product. You’ll find that we’re passionate about putting in the work to constantly improve on the things we’ve made.
  • The role says “Senior” but we do not delineate between junior and senior designers on the team. We’re looking for senior-level skill and experience in every role at Help Scout, partially because it works better in a remote culture.

About you:

  • Your passion is to work on large-scale software a lot of people use, but to be given ownership of the project from concept to completion. The design challenges are complex, and the work has a bunch of constraints. Despite the difficulty, this is the work you love most.
  • We all love a good pattern library and pixel-perfect design, but you prefer to get involved in a project way before then. For you, it starts with sketches, wireframes and a keen understanding of the problem from all angles.
  • You’re very thorough and detail-oriented. You don’t get tired of solving a problem and iterating on the solution, even after a few months of working towards the best experience.
  • You’re humble, yet opinionated about what makes a great product experience. You leverage your skills and expertise to help others and make the people around you better at their craft.
  • You have more than a few years of design experience, and you’ve grown so much that you cringe when you look back at your early work.
  • You can simplify complex problems and clearly articulate your thought process to others in writing. This is especially important in a remote culture like ours.
  • You collaborate well and communicate early and often. You explain your work by extrapolating on everything from your inklings and curiosities, to the rationale behind final your decisions.
  • You actively seek critical feedback. As a matter of fact, you can’t get enough of it, because you know that your work only gets better when your team puts their eyes on it.
  • You have strong taste, and your eye for visual design is as strong as your ability to dream up exceptional customer experiences.
  • You prefer to collaborate directly with developers and product stakeholders, carefully considering the tension between business and customer needs.
  • When it comes to understanding a problem, you have no hesitation in setting up customer interviews, doing usability testing, or conducting a survey.
  • This isn’t an absolute requirement, but strong HTML and CSS skills will likely make you a more successful product designer at Help Scout. If you can write JavaScript, it’s all the better, but we won’t ask you to write production code.

Who you'll work with

  • Linda Eliasen, Design Team Lead - You’ll be reporting to Linda. She’s been a designer like you, for companies like Mailchimp, Dropbox and Squarespace.
  • Design team -Sean,Jared(co-founder),BuzzandTonycan’t wait to meet you!
  • Ben Henderson, Director of Product - You’ll work with Ben and any other Product leads to craft specs and see projects through to completion. He ran Product at Campaign Monitor, and before that ran a client agency for eight years.
  • Nick Francis, CEO - Nick is still very hands-on with the product and design process. On some projects you’ll work directly with him to create something.

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary- We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Health and dental insurance- We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Aetna policy. If you're based outside the US, we offer a healthcare stipend.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance- We cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider. (currently US only)
  • Flexible vacation- Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption and foster care- 12 weeks for primary caretaker and 4 weeks for secondary caretaker.
  • 401k with 1% match- via Betterment for Business (currently US only)
  • Personal Development stipend- Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools- Each employee will be provided with a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent equipment of choice).
  • Home Office Stipend- You'll also receive $1,000 to spend on outfitting your home office, as well as up to $350 a month to rent a co-working space if you like.
  • Company Retreats- Twice a year, we get together to meet and work in person, covered by Help Scout.
  • Complete transparency- Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.
About Us

Help Scout is made by roughly 70 people in 40+ cities around the world, all with a passion for excellence in their craft.

We come from diverse backgrounds and are united by an enthusiasm for great products and delightful customer experiences.

Since launching in April of 2011, Help Scout now powers 8,000+ support teams in over 140 countries. Oursoftwareis used and trusted by businesses of every shape and size.

Designed to go the distance

Our mission is to foster the world’s customer-centric businesses by providing tools that serve customers in the most human, helpful way. While growth is important, team and values are paramount. We’re always striving to do impactful work we’re proud of in lieu of chasing overnight success.

We’re builders without borders

Our entire team is free to work remotely from wherever they choose. We overcome remote challenges through transparency, trust, and video conferencing. The reward is worth the effort—we’ll take talent, skill, and diverse perspectives over local geography any day.

Above all, we want Help Scout to be a place where passionate people can do their very best work. You won’t find any ping-pong tables or kegerators here. Instead, you’ll be surrounded by driven, supportive teammates who will push you to be better. We take work/life harmony seriously, too, as we want every career at Help Scout to be a long and satisfying one.

Diversity & Inclusion
We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to building a company that embraces and celebratesdiversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We are hiring for a mid-level UI/UX designer who is able to help us take complex workflows and distill them into a thoughtful experience for people using our app.

This position is on our growing design team, which works closely with our development teams as part of an iterative design process. You would have an important role in helping us redesign key parts of our app UI, and would also be part of an overall effort to create and standardize our design system. We're also looking for someone to help us grow as a team and solidify our design processes.

The kind of work we do
BriteCore is essentially a CMS for insurance companies. They use it to manage all aspects of their business, including tracking policies, managing contacts and handling claims.

This means our users typically see our app more as a business tool like Microsoft Word or Google Sheets than a website (even though it is completely a web-based app). They also are using BriteCore for several hours every day, and are concerned with doing things quickly and efficiently. This, along with the complicated nature of insurance, means we deal with some complex workflows, and try to set ourselves apart from our competitors with a smooth UX that helps them navigate these tough processes.

What you might be doing
We’re looking for a team member who thinks critically about user experience, and is able to see it through with a polished interface. This means you might do things like:
  • Ask in-depth questions to understand a process, and back up decisions with research and user tests
  • Iterate on designs using a variety of techniques, such as sketches, workflow diagrams and high-fidelity mockups
  • Create an aesthetically pleasing, on brand UI for a new or existing component in our design system

What it's like to work here
BriteCore is a remote-first company — even employees who live in our home city of Springfield, MO usually work from home! And most of the people you will work with are scattered across the US and the globe. This means that remote team members are just as much part of the company as local employees. We also allow a lot of flexibility in terms of time off. In return, we expect all of our employees to be productive and accountable, which means you'll work alongside a great, dedicated team.

Requirements & Responsibilities
  • Several years of experience in the field is preferred
  • Ability to create effective and beautiful interfaces that solve our user's problems
  • Iterate and improve on existing parts of the app
  • Inform design decisions with data, user testing
  • Communicate clearly
  • Welcome feedback and collaboration
  • Be friendly, confident, and patient with others
  • Self-direct
  • Stay up on industry best practices and trends

    • Invision

    Coding Experience is very helpful, but not required:
    • HTML5
    • SCSS, PostCSS

    • Benefit from working alongside and observing a team of world-class engineers and designers
    • Comprehensive health insurance coverage including medical, dental, and vision
    • Flexible schedule
    • Relaxed work environment
    • Remote work
    • Flexible learning time — explore your ideas and new technologies on the clock

Full-time

(Blacksburg, VA strongly preferred, but remote possible for perfect fit)

NewCity, a digital agency in Blacksburg, Virginia, is looking for a Senior Designer to join our team. You will work daily with our design and development staff, as well as our clients, to bring new ideas to life.

The Company

NewCity is a 23-year-old, 25-person firm, working in a highly collaborative, low-ego environment to create digital experiences for the real world. We ask big questions, dream big dreams, but at the end of the day we build things that work. Our culture is can-do, roll-up-your-sleeves, I’ve got your back and you’ve got mine. We’re constantly learning, experimenting and reinventing NewCity.

We’re organized around seven key disciplines: user experience, visual design, content strategy, front-end and back-end development, digital marketing and analytics, project management and business development. Our project teams are made of people from each discipline.

The Job

As a Senior Designer at NewCity, you will

  • inspire clients as you explore how their brand will shine in digital, occasionally developing new brand identities in the process.
  • take ownership of the design process from concept and design to presentation and delivery, working directly with clients and on 2 to 4 project teams at a time.
  • manage and mentor junior designers.
  • play an integral role in moving NewCity's creative approach forward.
  • periodically participate in sales pitches to prospective clients.
  • travel occasionally to work on-site directly with clients, usually not longer than 2-3 days at a time.

This is s full-time position. Preference will be given to applicants available to work at our office in Blacksburg, Virginia. We are open to considering full-time remote for candidates with successful experience as a remote team member and the references to prove it.

We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package.

You

  • You have 5+ years experience creating gorgeous, brand-driven, human-centered design for responsive web and mobile and an online portfolio that reflects your awesomeness.
  • You are proactive by nature and possess strong communication, collaboration, research, problem-solving and presentation skills.
  • You present design ideas clearly and effectively with insightful rationale.
  • You’ve got a solid understanding of how production and programming requirements affect your design. Knowing the opportunities and constraints of CSS, HTML and CMS platforms is fundamental in creating successful design solutions for our clients. Knowing how to collaboratively communicate your vision to developers is key to ensuring the quality of the final product.
  • You have a hunger to learn more and do things better. You're not afraid to break things or shift your assumptions in order to grow and excel, and love sharing what you've learned to help others do the same. We win together.
  • You use Sketch daily and maintain expert muscle-memory of Adobe Creative Suite to wield whenever necessary. Experience in logo design and brand systems, app design, prototyping (Principle, Figma, Framer, etc.) and familiarity with design systems are a big plus.

The Clients

If you review our portfolio, you’ll see a lot of work in higher education. It represents about 70% of our work each year. We love working with colleges and universities. It’s a dynamic, constantly changing space that always presents fresh challenges. The rest of our work is mainly with non-profits and B2B corporations. Roughly half our work each year is with repeat clients.

Our clients say there’s nothing cookie-cutter in our portfolio. They say we capture the unique DNA of their brand. That’s huge for us. You’ll be instrumental in helping us continue to do that.

Equal Opportunity

Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle of NewCity.  As an equal opportunity employer, employment is based upon personal capabilities, qualifications and performance. NewCity does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability or any other legally protected status.

We’re eager to bring more people onto our team who make us richer with their differences. Our industry has historically seen lower participation from minorities, but it’s something we want to help change.

Apply: If this sounds both challenging and fun to you, please apply on our website with your resume, cover letter, and portfolio. Indicate whether or not you are open to relocation in your cover letter. No phone calls please.

Geckoboard is a growing product company on a mission — we’re transforming the way businesses work by helping them make use of their data. We make it easy for our customers to create beautiful TV dashboards showing their most important business metrics.

To better communicate this message, we’re looking for a Web Designer and Developer to help us make some changes to our website. You’ll be designing and building a number of new landing pages to explain the benefits of Geckoboard for different job functions and integration types. These pages will be persuasive, informative and bundled with visual appeal, but most importantly, deliver a fantastic user experience.

*Based in our London office*, you’ll be joining our team for an initial *one-month contract*, with a possible extension to two-months.

*You will be:*
* Working alongside our Creative Copywriter and a Project Manager to design and build landing pages that deliver an exceptional user experience and convert our users.
* Owning the process through: mockups, design, layout and build.
* Taking onboard feedback and discovering the best solutions that balance user experience, visual design, communicating Geckoboard’s message effectively and converting users.
* Working in an iterative process where we ship, test and refine.

*You should apply if:*
* You enjoy designing and building attractive landing pages that deliver a fantastic user experience and convert users!
* You’re more than comfortable with HTML, CSS, and ideally Sass and Bourbon.
* You’re familiar with Siteleaf, Jekyll, or any other CMS that uses the Liquid templating language.

*Bonus points:*
* Javascript experience.
* Experience creating icons and illustrations.

*Please be sure to include your portfolio and examples of your past work in your application.*



The Geckoboard Story

Thousands of businesses use Geckoboard to build live TV Dashboards that focus teams on what matters. We take the complexity out of connecting data and make it simple for anyone to understand key metrics at a glance. We have pre-built integrations with 60+ tools including Google Analytics, Salesforce, Zendesk, Intercom and Google Sheets and our customers include Marketo, Slack, and Skyscanner.

In our mission to make data useful, our growing team of 40+ is headquartered in London and span across eight time zones - from Mumbai to London, San Francisco to Hawaii and more. We're always looking for people with diverse backgrounds who bring unique perspectives and skills to join our team and in return we constantly strive to ensure that we offer the most encouraging, inclusive, and efficient environment possible.

We don't just pay lip service to work-life balance, we actively and strongly encourage it. Flexible working hours and the ability to regularly work from home lets you work in a way that fits you and your family. We see our contractual obligation to offer 25 days of paid holiday as a minimum for everyone in the organisation, not a limit.

We actively contribute to professional development, courses, conferences, and books. Our Engineering & Product team also run fortnightly "Innovation Wednesdays", where everyone has complete freedom to work on anything that interests them, from contributing to open source, to learning a new skill, or improving our internal tools and processes.

And, don’t take our word for it, see what the team say about the projects they work on: "https://medium.com/geckoboard-under-the-hood":https://medium.com/geckoboard-under-the-hood and their experience of working with us on Glassdoor: "https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/Geckoboard-Reviews-E878996.htm":https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/Geckoboard-Reviews-E878996.htm. Job Description

We’re looking for an incredible UX designer with interaction and visual design skills to join us on a quest in helping all players get better and unlock their potential. You’ll have the chance to work on a personal performance analytics platform for gamers that is the first of its kind in a booming eSports industry that’s been growing exponentially for years.

This means the chance to improve the gaming experience of your fellow summoners all over the world, working alongside video game enthusiasts like yourself. The aim of our company is to build powerful tools that enable all players to step up their game and present their best self to the community they play in, AND of course, we want it to be a fun journey…

That’s where you come in! As a UX designer, we want you to design the interface that our players see and interact with every day. Players need to fall in love with our tool as soon as they start using it, and your aesthetic sense is what will seduce them. In fact, they need to love using it so much that they reach a point they won't be able to live without it! League of Legends is where we are starting, but if you love all sorts of games and find yourself thinking about tools you could create for them, you are definitely in the right place with us.

We have a highly transparent work philosophy for everything from workflow to salary. The team is distributed all over the world, so where you want to pitch up in a hammock in Thailand, work from your mother’s basement in Michigan or anything in between doesn’t matter. Your love for League and video games, your attention to detail, and love for user experience does.

Role-specific skills we’re looking for:

1. We want you to lead the design of the product and make sure that our app is beautiful and easy to use.
- We want you to think and design as an end user. To do that, you have to understand the nature of our users and be one of them. That means you should probably play a lot of games…competitively...

2. You should be familiar with the design process of a new app or feature.
- Be self-reliant enough to carry the whole team through the process. Start with user stories, sketches, and prototypes. Finish with the design of the interfaces and user testing.

3. You should be able to take broad concepts or ideas and turn them into valuable features for our users.
- Understand business needs and connect them with design decisions that can be articulated in individual or group settings.
- Partner with engineers, product managers, and data scientists to oversee the user experience of a product from concept to launch — and then continue to improve it.

4. Bonus points for:
- Experience in designing Dashboards for SaaS products.
- Experience in designing complex interfaces and making them easy to understand.
- Fostering a culture of design.

Life skills we value:

1. Plays the games with some measure of desire to improve.
- Of course, we want you to be someone who plays the games we create our tools around. Playing them may be enough, but to communicate to players effectively you must have some sort of latent desire to improve…No we don’t care if you are Bronze or Diamond.

2. Self-initiated, fast learner with a positive attitude.
- We don’t want to tell you what to do all the time. Hopefully, you will tell us what we need to be doing.
- We want “can do” people, not “can’t do” people. In our experience, passion breeds enthusiasm, which breeds a strong desire to learn. That’s why we want to know you care.

3. Strong sense of team spirit thriving in a fast-paced environment.
- Think of our team as a ranked team, we strive for excellence and don’t waste each other's time with BS.
- We all support each other, but that also means being good critics. Be able to take criticism! That is the only real path to improvement!

4. Excellent attention to detail, quality of work and time management.
- Be proud of your work, not for our sake, but for yours. We will be proud too! - Working hard is important, but being efficient is more important, so using your time wisely is paramount to successful projects.

If you love games and have a strong desire to create beautiful products for a passionate community of competitive gamers, this is the place for you. We really want to help players be their best self when playing with others around the world, and you should help us create that environment.
